title: (x) George Harrison "All Things Must Pass" album cover - Abbott Old Style {Patricia}
content:
Hand drawn? If so, anything similar?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/files/George_Harrison-All_Things_.jpg)
author: Fisheye

comments.content: I recall the design (when the orignal album came out) and I’ve seen the face before as well, but I’m not near my old pre-digital type books at the moment.

Abbott Old Style

Renamed “Abbey Road” and rejigged (note the R) here

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/abbey-road-nf/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070105024205/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/abbey-road-nf/)

Yep, it’s not hand-drawn. It also appears on [this album cover](http://web.archive.org/web/20070105024205/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image:JethroTull-albums-heavyhorses.jpg), but I’ll have to go through a couple of old books to see if I can spot it — I just can’t recall the name of the typeface.
Oops! Thanks Patty! I guess we posted at the same time! :-)
Found on page one (Abb…) of one of those old type books.

Patty… you’re FAB!  
_Patty in the skyyyyyy with diamonds… cooocooocachoo!_
Abbey Road is the first album I remember listening to as a kid. I still have my parents old scratched LP. Can’t bear to part with it.
Old LPs should never be parted with, scratches or no. :-)
